Origins: In August 2015, a news-like link reporting that the popular soft drink Mountain Dew (owned by Pepsico) was going to be "cancelled" started circulating around social media. Although the link appeared to point to a real news story, it was generated by the trolling web site FeedNewz:
Fact Check: Is the soft drink Mountain Dew being discontinued?
Description: The content on FeedNews.com is user created. Anyone with an Internet connection can use the web site, as well as prank.link and fakeshare.com, to create fake news headlines: When social media users click on links created by one of the above-mentioned web sites, they get redirected to a "You Got Owned" page. FeedNews.com then encourages anyone who was fooled by the prank to share it again with their own social media circles, ensuring that the pranks go viral: Recently, FeedNewz.com has helped spread fake stories about MMA champion Ronda Rousey failing a drug test, the Taco Bell fast food chain closing all their outlets, and Channing Tatum coming out as gay. Last updated: 4 August 2015
Example: [Collected via e-mail, July 2015] I keep seeing a link people posted on facebook that got me wondering is this true or not Mountain Dew soon to be cancelled?
Claim: The soft drink Mountain Dew is being discontinued.
